SEARCH
Package sh.brane.rpc

Interface Brane.Signer

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Brane
Enclosing interface:
Brane
public static sealed interface Brane.Signer extends Brane
Full-featured client with transaction signing capability.

Signer extends all read operations with the ability to sign and send transactions to the blockchain. This is the client type to use when your application needs to modify blockchain state.

Signing Capability

A Signer client wraps a cryptographic signer (typically a PrivateKey) that can sign transactions. The signing happens locally - private keys never leave your application.

Creating a Signer


 // Create the cryptographic signer
 Signer key = PrivateKey.fromHex("0xac0974bec39a17e36ba4a6b4d238ff944bacb478cbed5efcae784d7bf4f2ff80");

 // Via static factory (simplest)
 Brane.Signer client = Brane.connect("https://eth.example.com", key);

 // Via builder (with configuration)
 Brane.Signer client = Brane.builder()
     .rpcUrl("https://eth.example.com")
     .signer(key)
     .chain(ChainProfiles.MAINNET)
     .retries(5)
     .buildSigner();

Sending Transactions

Fire and forget: 


 TransactionRequest request = TransactionRequest.builder()
     .to(recipient)
     .value(Wei.fromEther("1.0"))
     .build();

 // Returns immediately after broadcast
 Hash txHash = client.sendTransaction(request);
 System.out.println("Transaction submitted: " + txHash);

Wait for confirmation: 


 // Wait up to 60 seconds for confirmation (default)
 TransactionReceipt receipt = client.sendTransactionAndWait(request);

 // Or with custom timeout
 TransactionReceipt receipt = client.sendTransactionAndWait(request, 120_000, 2_000);

 if (receipt.status() == 1) {
     System.out.println("Transaction succeeded in block " + receipt.blockNumber());
 }

Transaction Auto-Fill

When sending transactions, the client automatically fills in missing fields:

  • nonce: Fetched from eth_getTransactionCount
  • gasLimit: Estimated via eth_estimateGas
  • maxFeePerGas/maxPriorityFeePerGas: Calculated from current base fee
  • chainId: Fetched from eth_chainId

You can override any of these by setting them explicitly in the request.

Contract Interactions


 // Encode a contract call
 HexData data = Abi.encodeFunctionCall("transfer(address,uint256)",
     recipient, Wei.fromEther("100").toBigInteger());

 TransactionRequest request = TransactionRequest.builder()
     .to(tokenAddress)
     .data(data)
     .build();

 TransactionReceipt receipt = client.sendTransactionAndWait(request);
Since:
0.1.0

  • Method Details

    • sendTransaction

      Hash sendTransaction(TransactionRequest request)
      Submits a transaction to the blockchain and returns immediately.

      This method:

      1. Fills in missing gas/nonce fields if null in the request
      2. Signs the transaction using the configured signer
      3. Broadcasts via eth_sendRawTransaction
      4. Returns the transaction hash without waiting for confirmation

      Note: The transaction is submitted but NOT confirmed. Use sendTransactionAndWait(sh.brane.core.model.TransactionRequest) if you need to wait for confirmation.

      Parameters:
      request - the transaction request with at minimum a from address; all other fields are optional and will be auto-filled
      Returns:
      the transaction hash of the submitted transaction
      Since:
      0.1.0

    • sendTransactionAndWait

      default TransactionReceipt sendTransactionAndWait(TransactionRequest request)
      Submits a transaction and waits for it to be confirmed in a block using default settings.

      This is a convenience method that uses default timeout (60 seconds) and poll interval (1 second). For custom settings, use sendTransactionAndWait(TransactionRequest, long, long).

      This method combines sendTransaction(sh.brane.core.model.TransactionRequest) with polling for the receipt. It will:

      1. Submit the transaction (same as sendTransaction(sh.brane.core.model.TransactionRequest))
      2. Poll eth_getTransactionReceipt every second
      3. Return the receipt once the transaction is included in a block
      4. Throw an exception if 60 seconds is exceeded or transaction reverts
      Parameters:
      request - the transaction request
      Returns:
      the transaction receipt once confirmed
      Since:
      0.1.0

    • sendTransactionAndWait

      TransactionReceipt sendTransactionAndWait(TransactionRequest request, long timeoutMillis, long pollIntervalMillis)
      Submits a transaction and waits for it to be confirmed in a block.

      This method combines sendTransaction(sh.brane.core.model.TransactionRequest) with polling for the receipt. It will:

      1. Submit the transaction (same as sendTransaction(sh.brane.core.model.TransactionRequest))
      2. Poll eth_getTransactionReceipt at the specified interval
      3. Return the receipt once the transaction is included in a block
      4. Throw an exception if timeout is reached or transaction reverts
      Parameters:
      request - the transaction request
      timeoutMillis - maximum time to wait for confirmation, in milliseconds
      pollIntervalMillis - how often to poll for the receipt, in milliseconds
      Returns:
      the transaction receipt once confirmed
      Since:
      0.1.0

    • sendBlobTransaction

      Hash sendBlobTransaction(BlobTransactionRequest request)
      Submits an EIP-4844 blob transaction to the blockchain and returns immediately.

      This method:

      1. Fills in missing gas/nonce fields if null in the request
      2. Signs the transaction using the configured signer
      3. Broadcasts via eth_sendRawTransaction with the blob sidecar
      4. Returns the transaction hash without waiting for confirmation

      Note: The transaction is submitted but NOT confirmed. Use Brane.getTransactionReceipt(Hash) to check confirmation status.

      Example: 

      
 BlobSidecar sidecar = BlobSidecar.from(blobs, commitments, proofs);
 BlobTransactionRequest request = new BlobTransactionRequest(
     null, // from (auto-filled from signer)
     contractAddress,
     null, // value
     null, // gasLimit (auto-estimated)
     null, // maxPriorityFeePerGas (auto-filled)
     null, // maxFeePerGas (auto-filled)
     null, // maxFeePerBlobGas (auto-filled)
     null, // nonce (auto-fetched)
     calldata,
     null, // accessList
     sidecar
 );
 Hash txHash = client.sendBlobTransaction(request);
      Parameters:
      request - the blob transaction request with at minimum a to address and sidecar; all other fields are optional and will be auto-filled
      Returns:
      the transaction hash of the submitted transaction
      Since:
      0.4.0

    • sendBlobTransactionAndWait

      default TransactionReceipt sendBlobTransactionAndWait(BlobTransactionRequest request)
      Submits an EIP-4844 blob transaction and waits for it to be confirmed using default settings.

      This is a convenience method that uses default timeout (60 seconds) and poll interval (2 seconds). For custom settings, use sendBlobTransactionAndWait(BlobTransactionRequest, long, long).

      This method combines sendBlobTransaction(sh.brane.core.model.BlobTransactionRequest) with polling for the receipt. It will:

      1. Submit the blob transaction (same as sendBlobTransaction(sh.brane.core.model.BlobTransactionRequest))
      2. Poll eth_getTransactionReceipt every 2 seconds
      3. Return the receipt once the transaction is included in a block
      4. Throw an exception if 60 seconds is exceeded or transaction reverts
      Parameters:
      request - the blob transaction request
      Returns:
      the transaction receipt once confirmed
      Since:
      0.4.0

    • sendBlobTransactionAndWait

      default TransactionReceipt sendBlobTransactionAndWait(BlobTransactionRequest request, long timeoutMillis, long pollIntervalMillis)
      Submits an EIP-4844 blob transaction and waits for it to be confirmed in a block.

      This method combines sendBlobTransaction(sh.brane.core.model.BlobTransactionRequest) with polling for the receipt. It will:

      1. Submit the blob transaction (same as sendBlobTransaction(sh.brane.core.model.BlobTransactionRequest))
      2. Poll eth_getTransactionReceipt at the specified interval
      3. Return the receipt once the transaction is included in a block
      4. Throw an exception if timeout is reached or transaction reverts
      Parameters:

      timeoutMillis - maximum time to wait for confirmation, in milliseconds
      pollIntervalMillis - how often to poll for the receipt, in milliseconds
      Returns:
      the transaction receipt once confirmed
      Since:
